headline: U.S. Sen. Rob Portman endorses Jane Timken in crowded GOP primary for Ohio Senate seat
author: Jason Williams
sentences: In a statement provided to The (Cincinnati) Enquirer's political columnist Jason Williams, Portman lauded Timken's work as chair of the Ohio Republican Party and said she's best equipped to "advance conservative Republican policies to help Ohio workers and families."

"Rob successfully led the effort to pass President Trump’s tax cuts, is the leader in the U.S. Senate in fighting the opioid epidemic, and has consistently delivered results for Ohio on issue after issue."

Haley BeMiller is a reporter for the USA TODAY Network Ohio Bureau, which serves the Columbus Dispatch, Cincinnati Enquirer, Akron Beacon Journal and 18 other affiliated news organizations across Ohio.
"In my conversations with Senator Portman over the past year, including this morning, he made clear that his support for Jane Timken was predicated on personal friendship," Dolan said in a statement.
"She led the effort as Ohio Republican Party chair to elect Republicans to all statewide constitutional offices in 2018, and to win Ohio by 8 points for President Trump in 2020," he said.
"I respect Rob’s service, but each day more and more Ohio Republicans recognize the fact I am the only candidate with a record of conservative leadership that gets results for Ohio."
Timken was critical of the infrastructure deal spearheaded by Portman, in large part because of a social spending package that Democrats sought to tie to the fate of infrastructure.
"I am confident in her ability to win both the primary and the general elections, ensuring that this Senate seat remains Republican with a 50-50 Senate, and so much at stake."
Portman's pending retirement ignited an expensive, chaotic GOP primary that's drawn candidates pledging to disrupt the conservative establishment that he represents.
Portman's endorsement is also a blow to Dolan, who actively touted the infrastructure deal and paints himself as the only traditional conservative in the race.
Rob Portman endorsed Jane Timken in the crowded GOP Senate primary on Wednesday, ending months of speculation over who he'd anoint as his preferred successor.
"Senator Portman is a thoughtful, conservative leader who has served Ohio with distinction, and I’m honored to have his support," Timken said in a statement.
Mandel continues to trump his opponents while spending less of his own money on the race, although his lead has narrowed since last year.
All of the candidates, with the exception of Dolan, have anchored their campaigns around Trump in an effort to secure his endorsement.
Timken stands to benefit from Portman's deep ties in Ohio politics, especially after losing ground in recent polls on the primary.
Still, Portman has close ties to Timken and her family, and Jane Portman has supported Timken on the campaign trail.
The campaign expects about $800,000 to come in from donors who were waiting for Portman to get on board.
Businessman Bernie Moreno dropped out earlier this month after consulting former President Donald Trump.
Also vying for the nomination are former Ohio treasurer Josh Mandel, "Hillbilly Elegy" author J.D.
